justification: High damage potential due to unauthorized access, high reproducibility with unauthenticated APIs, moderate exploitability, widespread affected users, and moderate discoverability.
recommendations: Implement strict API authentication (OAuth2, JWT).; Enforce rate limiting and input validation.; Monitor API access logs for suspicious activity.

justification: High damage potential from data corruption, moderate reproducibility, moderate exploitability, widespread affected users, and moderate discoverability.
recommendations: Implement database access controls and encryption.; Enable audit logging for database changes.; Use application-level data validation.

justification: High damage potential from data interception, high reproducibility with insecure channels, moderate exploitability, widespread affected users, and high discoverability.
recommendations: Mandate TLS encryption for all internal/external communications.; Use secure protocols (HTTPS, WSS) and certificate pinning.; Regularly scan for vulnerabilities in communication channels.

threat_title: Denial of Service on Kubernetes Cluster
justification: Very high damage potential from service unavailability, high reproducibility via resource exhaustion, moderate exploitability, widespread affected users, and high discoverability.
recommendations: Implement Kubernetes resource quotas and limits.; Deploy auto-scaling and load balancing.; Monitor cluster health and set up alerts for anomalies.

threat_title: Elevation of Privilege via Container Registry Vulnerabilities
recommendations: Use private, signed container registries (e.g., Harbor).; Enforce strict access controls and image scanning.; Regularly update registry and container images.
